required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of BCMA-directed CAR-T Cells Treatment in Subjects With r/r Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ⅰ Study Evaluating Safety and Efficacy of C-CAR088 Treatment in Subjects With Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

clinical_study.source: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, non-randomized and dose-escalation study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of C-CAR088 in relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma patient.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will include the following sequential phases: Screening, Pre- Treatment (Cell Product Preparation, Lymphodepleting Chemotherapy), C-CAR088 infusion and Follow-up.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: The incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs)

secondary_outcome.description: ORR(including sCR / CR / VGPR / PR, based on IMWG 2016 efficacy evaluation criteria)
PFS(based on IMWG 2016 efficacy evaluation criteria)

secondary_outcome.measure: The CART cell duration in vivo
secondary_outcome.description: The copys of BCMA-CART DNA in peripheral blood with qPCR method

secondary_outcome.measure: The soluble BCMA changes in peripheral blood
secondary_outcome.description: The amount of soluble BCMA in peripheral blood with ELISA method

arm_group.description: Lymphocytes will be transduced with lentiviral vector containing CAR-BCMA gene.

intervention.description: Autologous BCMA-directed CAR-T cells, single infusion intravenously at a target dose of 1.0-9.0 x 10^6 anti-BCMA CAR+T cells/kg. Divided into three dose ranges of low(1.0-3.0×10^6 CAR+T cells/kg),medium(3.0-6.0×10^6 CAR+T cells/kg) and high(6.0-9.0×10^6 CAR+T cells/kg). Other Name: CBM.BCMA Chimeric Antigen Receptor T cell.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital
